p: The current case fatality rate is calculated at approximately 2% ( Fauci et al., 2020). COVID-19 is already responsible for more fatalities than SARS CoV-1 and MERS combined ( Mahase, 2020). Although COVID-19 has a significantly lower case fatality rate than SARS CoV-1 (10%) and MERS (30%), this novel virus has the ability to spread undetected through a prolonged asymptomatic incubation period, which increases transmission and thus increases the relative mortality rate. When comparing mortality across the affected countries, Italy has one of the highest death rates related to COVID-19.
